security: This material contains information affecting the National Defense of the United States within the meaning of the Espionage Laws, Title 18, U.S.C., secs. 793 and 794, the transmission or revelation of which in any manner to an unauthorized person is prohibited by law.
summary: A report identifies Julian NOVAS Fernandez as a Cuban Intelligence Officer observed at the Cuban Embassy in Mexico City in March 1964, though later information suggests he was en route to his post as Commercial Attache at the Cuban Consulate in Kingston, Jamaica.
summary_one_paragraph: This report, dated August 27, 1964, identifies Julian NOVAS Fernandez as a Cuban intelligence officer. A former Cuban IS officer reported seeing Novas at the Cuban Embassy in Mexico City in March 1964. However, subsequent reports from a Jamaican source indicate that Novas arrived in Kingston, Jamaica, on March 18, 1964, to serve as Commercial Attache at the Cuban Consulate. He is described as having an American appearance, speaking excellent English, and being preoccupied with women. Intelligence suggests his appointment may indicate he is the new Cuban Intelligence Service chief in Jamaica, succeeding Gerardo SANCHEZ Robert.
title: Julian NOVAS Fernandez
